FacilityName: Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas Further Processing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas is a poultry processing facility that stores and uses a chemical that is regulated by EPA's Risk Management Program.

Wayne Farms believes the ammonia we store and handle on site has a very real and potential danger.  Wayne Farms LLC -  Douglas chemical storage and handling facilities:
1.  are properly designed
2.  have effective operation and maintenance procedures
3.  employ trained operators and tecchnicians
4.  periodically conduct safety audits, and
5. are constantly upgrading its processes to meet or exceed industry standards

Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas also has taken a proactive approach towards coordinating emergency efforts with the Fire Department.  The Coffee County E.M.A. has a copy of our emergency response program and is well trained and prepared to respond to the potential spills and leaks that may occur at the Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas facility.  The Douglas Fire Department conducts annual site visits to our facility and is prepared to respond to a possible spill or leak.  There have been no reportable ammonia releases at this faccility in the past five years.

A facility which maintains high standards, such as Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas, provides less public risk than a facility that does not provide safe operations. Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas complies with Federal OSHA rules and guidelines for safe handling, storage and operation of chemical systems.  We also utilize outside experts to periodically inspect our systems integrity and train systems operators.

Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas used EPA's OCA Guidance for off-site consequence analysis.

CONCLUSION
Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas believes that the poultry industry should proactively inform the public of the potential dangers and the actions that Wayne Farms LLC - DQHIII Business Unit has taken to minimize these dangers.  Wayne Farms LLC - Douglas (one of the larger employers in Coffee County) has a long-great ongoing relationship with the community.  We encourage any and all ci
tizens who have concerns or questions to contact our facility.  We look forward to continuing our relationship in Coffee County.
